meanings.definition: To cause (an event or situation) to happen or exist
meanings.sent1: The loud noise triggered the car alarm.
meanings.sent2: The smell of fresh cookies triggered my hunger.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected rain triggered a rush for umbrellas.
meanings.sent4: His words triggered a wave of laughter in the room.
meanings.sent5: The bright colors triggered a sense of joy in the children.

meanings.definition: To set off a mechanism that releases a spring or catch
meanings.sent1: Pressing the button triggered the toy to move.
meanings.sent2: The lever triggered the trap door to open.
meanings.sent3: The red wire triggered the fireworks to start.
meanings.sent4: The switch triggered the lights to turn on.
meanings.sent5: The key triggered the music box to play a melody.

meanings.definition: To provoke or stir up (a reaction or emotion)
meanings.sent1: Her comment triggered a feeling of sadness in him.
meanings.sent2: The movie triggered memories of his childhood.
meanings.sent3: The funny joke triggered a fit of giggles.
meanings.sent4: The touching story triggered tears in the audience.
meanings.sent5: The surprise party triggered a sense of excitement in her heart.
